newsitem.title: USA: Kentucky Electric sees Q3, Q4 improvement.
newsitem.headline: Kentucky Electric sees Q3, Q4 improvement.

text.p: Kentucky Electric Steel Inc on Thursday said its operating results in the third and fourth quarters should improve because of strong demand in some markets and higher productivity.
While pricing is still soft this spring, demand is strong in some markets, and prices on many products were raised effective in March and April, Kentucky Electric Steel said.

Earlier the company posted a fiscal second-quarter loss of $0.36 a share compared with earnings of $0.05 a share in the comparable period a year earlier. Its latest second quarter ended March 29, 1997.

The steelmaker said its performance in the second quarter and the first six months of its fiscal year suffered amid downward pricing pressures, start-up costs and higher conversion costs mainly related to the 10-day shutdown of a melt shop in late December and early January.
